visualization_prompt: Generate an item chart showing political party seat distribution in a synthetic parliament using proportional circular encoding with improved group spacing
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains 12 categorical entries representing political factions with quantitative seat allocations (μ=82.9, σ=35.8). Synthetic seat counts follow a bimodal distribution reflecting typical parliamentary dynamics, with larger establishment parties (150-200 seats) and smaller issue-based groups (40-80 seats). Colors use conventional political associations (reds=progressive, blues=conservative, greens=environmental).

The circular item chart maximizes data-ink ratio by encoding seat counts through arc lengths while maintaining categorical discrimination through color. Gradient fills (radial opacity from 0.8 to 0.2) enhance depth perception per Cairo's principles. Point padding (0.8×itemSize) creates visual separation between adjacent groups while maintaining proportional representation accuracy. Responsive labels maintain readability across viewport sizes through dynamic positioning.
